metadata.title: CVE-2014-4678 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The safe_eval function in Ansible before 1.6.4 does not properly restrictthe code subset, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codevia crafted instructions. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 1.6.6+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ansible package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.6+dfsg-1').
